lines: Sorry, you're still too young for this experience.  Come back later.
Sorry, you're too old for this experience.

You and your friends are in the living room listening to albums when your Mom comes breezing through the door. As you greet her, she begins straightening out your hair. You can hear your friends snickering under their breaths.
Because your family relations are good, you tolerate the embarrassment well, being careful not to hurt her feelings.
You are absolutely mortified. You clench your teeth and tell her to stop.
Because you are somewhat hostile (your Gentleness characteristic is low) you exaggerate your protest by yelling, "CUT IT OUT!" Your mom gets upset.
